results.title: The Draughtsman's contract
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, David Payne and Channel Four Television
results.brief_description: It is the summer of 1694. An ambitious young draughtsman is contracted to draw the house and estate of the wealthy Mrs Herbert. However, what outwardly appears to be a most proper household is thrown into chaos as his contract includes unrestricted freedom on the estate and Mrs Herbert’s most intimate hospitality. Not even Mrs Herbert’s daughter escapes his charm and magnetism in this intriguing movie of murder, adultery and double values.

results.title: The Dragons of the Galapagos
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, National Geographic Society, BBC-TV and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Filmed by David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook and narrated by David Attenborough, this spectacular production tells the story of the incredible struggle for survival of the dragons of the Galapagos Archipelago. The lives of these giant lizards, called land iguanas, are intimately linked with the Archipelagos most active volcano. We follow the annual migration of the land iguanas up the steep slopes of the 1,500 metre volcano and into the steaming caldera where they lay their eggs. Along the coast of the island the worlds only sea-going lizards take us into one of the most exciting marine environments on earth, a world of huge balls of baitfish and masses of seals, dolphins and penguins.

results.title: The Dragon's tears
results.creator_credit: John Korty, McGraw-Hill Films and Contemproary Films
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of Hirosuke Hamada’s story of a little boy’s fearless act of inviting a dragon to his birthday party. Utilizes Japanese-style watercolour and art work. Narrated by Robert Morse. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Drag
results.creator_credit: Carlos Marchiori, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon about a young man who becomes a chain smoker. Explains to young people the psychology of the smoking habit, including the part played by cigarette advertising.

results.title: The Dove
results.creator_credit: Charles Jarrott, Gregory Peck and St George Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Dove” by Robin Lee Graham and Derek Gill this film depicts the true story of Graham’s five year solo voyage around the world. The photography is breathtaking, as we follow Graham (Joseph Bottoms) as he sails to Fiji, Australia, Mozambique, South Africa and Los Angeles, covering a distance of 30,000 miles. Graham has no human contact during his trip, just the companionship of his cats. However, when he stops at Fiji he falls in love with Patti Ratteree (Deborah Raffin), and his departure from her is more painful due to his isolation. An inspirational film about courage and ambition that can be enjoyed by the whole family.

results.title: The Dounreay project
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, UK Atomic Energy Authority and Ace Films
results.brief_description: This film shows the construction of the Dounreay Reactor. From redesigning the coastline and big tunnels beneath the ocean to cement monoliths with steel plating. We see every part of Dounreay being built and clearly explained. A product of knowledge and proudness in its day - and sadly to become one day dangerous and obsolete.

results.title: The Double life of Veronique = La Double vie de Veronique
results.creator_credit: Krzysztof Kieslowski, Leonardo De La Fuerite, Studio Canal+ and Sideral Productions
results.brief_description: Two girls are born on the same day - one in Poland, the other in France. 25 years later they share the same looks, name and a great musical talent. They also share a potentially fatal heart disease. Though they live a world apart, Veronique and Veronika, (both played by Irene Jacob) are deeply linked in a way that defies explanation. In a mystical twist of fate, these two women will meet in a crowded city square and set in motion a series of dramatic events, ensuring that one must die so that the other can live. French and Polish dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Double helix
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, EFVA and Anvil Films
results.brief_description: Part of the Nobel Laureates series. Shows the work of several scientists in determining the structure of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). Uses animated diagrams to illustrate the structure of DNA. Discusses the significance of DNA in all living organisms. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Double headed eagle: Hitler's rise to power 1918-1933
results.creator_credit: Lutz Becker, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson, British Film Institute and Argos Films
results.brief_description: This extraordinary documentary charts the rise to power of Hitler and the Nazis, through the chaos of the Weimar republic. Rather than using voice-over narration the film relies on newsreels, home movie footage, and extracts from musicals and documentaries of the period to describe the state of German society during turbulent times. In doing so it reveals the disintegration of the old Germany and the advancement of the new, as represented by young Adolf Hitler and his peers. The film is broken into chapters, each dedicated to a different year during this period. Written by Lutz Becker and Philippe Mora. In German with English subtitles and captions.
